choices.text:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
Harmony used discarded paper to make notepads for her friends. She would fold five letter size pieces of paper three times then cut along the lines. She would then stack the smaller note papers and staple them together. How long would one notepad last if someone wrote ten notes per day?

### Response:

Based on your description, Harmony used five sheets of letter-sized paper to make a notepad by folding it three times and cutting along the lines. She then stacked the smaller note papers and stapled them together. 
If someone wrote ten notes per day using one notepad made from these materials, they would consume all five sheets of paper in approximately:
- 10 days for writing on both sides (20 pages)
- 5 days for writing only on the front side (10 pages)
Therefore, one notepad should last at least ten days if someone writes ten notes per day.
